full_title_en: Refractory Epilepsy Screening Tool for Lennox–Gastaut Syndrome (REST-LGS)
instructions_en: Lennox-Gastaut Syndrome can be one of the most challenging epileptic disorders to identify. Because of this, this study used expert consensus to develop criteria to aid in its diagnosis. This study still requires external validation.
search_abbreviation_en: Refractory Epilepsy Screening Tool for Lennox–Gastaut Syndrome (REST-LGS), REST-LGS, lennox gastaut syndrome, lennox gastaut, lennox, lgs, rest
medium_description_en: Provides diagnostic criteria for Lennox-Gastaut Syndrome (LGS).

about.formula_en:
Evaluation of the patient with the following criteria:

Major criteria:

    1. ≥2 seizure types.
    2. Seizure onset before age of 12 years.
    3. History of EEG with generalized slow spike-and-wave (SSW) discharges (<2.5 Hz).
    4. Cognitive impairment since childhood (may include past or current learning difficulties, history of special education, autism, intellectual disabilities, or developmental delays).

Minor criteria:

    1. Persistent seizures despite trial of ≥2 antiseizure medications.
    2. History of vagal nerve stimulator (VNS), ketogenic diet, or epilepsy surgery.
    3. Evidence of seizure-related helmet use, or head or face injuries.
    4. One of the following EEG abnormalities: multifocal spikes, symptomatic generalized discharges, generalized polyspikes, generalized periods of attenuation of background/electrodecrement, or paroxysmal fast activity.
about.more_info_en: Note: The original study only notes that “a majority of patients with confirmed LGS diagnosis met 3 major criteria and 2-3 minor criteria.” Because of that, this tool provides a “likely diagnosis” for users that input at least 3 major and at least 2 minor criteria (Piña-Garza 2019).

Validation.text: Piña-Garza JE, Boyce D, Tworek DM, et al. The refractory epilepsy screening tool for Lennox–Gastaut syndrome (Rest-lgs). Epilepsy Behav. 2019;90:148-153.

Original/Primary Reference.text: Piña-Garza JE, Boyce D, Tworek DM, et al. The refractory epilepsy screening tool for Lennox–Gastaut syndrome (Rest-lgs). Epilepsy Behav. 2019;90:148-153.

creator_info.about_en: Jesus Eric Piña Garza, MD, is a professor of neurology and pediatrics at Children's Hospital at Centennial Medical Center in Tennessee. He is also the director of the department of pediatric epilepsy. Dr. Piña-Garza's primary research is focused on the management of pediatric seizure disorders.
